translations.manual_step_1_paragraph: In this setup guide, we'll assist you in preparing your Laravel environment. You've been directed to this page because either Composer and NodeJS are not installed on your system, or the shell_exec/exec functions are disabled in your PHP configuration. These are essential components for running Laravel projects effectively. Follow the steps outlined here to resolve these issues and get your environment up and running.
translations.manual_nodejs_installation_linux: Follow the steps below based on your Linux distribution:
translations.manual_composer_windows: Download the latest installer for Composer from Composer's website. Run it to install.
translations.manual_nodejs_windows: For NodeJS, download the Windows installer from NodeJS's website.
translations.manual_step_3_paragraph: Verify that Composer and NodeJS are installed correctly by running the following commands in your terminal or command prompt:
translations.manual_step_4_paragraph: After installing the necessary dependencies, it's time to configure your Laravel project. This step involves navigating into your project directory and installing backend and frontend dependencies using Composer and npm. These commands will set up Laravel's framework and prepare the project for development. Once completed, your environment will be ready to run and customize.
translations.manual_step_5_paragraph: Congratulations! You've successfully followed all the steps to set up your Laravel environment. By clicking the 'Finish' button, you will be redirected to complete the setup process and finalize the configuration of your project. Thank you for your effort! üòä
translations.step_2_description: Ensure your server meets all necessary requirements
translations.step_3_description: Install all required dependencies for your application
translations.step_5_description: Enter website details like name and URL
translations.step_7_description: Review the installation summary and complete the process
translations.welcome_paragraph: This installer will guide you through the process of setting up your Laravel application. Follow the steps below to complete the installation.
translations.requirements_paragraph: Ensure your server meets all necessary requirements y verifying its compatibility with the required software versions, checking for installed dependencies, ensuring proper file permissions, and optimizing performance for a seamless user experience.

translations.please_fix_issues_message: Please fix the above issues before continuing.
translations.optional_checks_failed_message: Optional checks failed. You can proceed, but some features may be limited.
translations.migration_description:
This migration step allows you to transfer all databases with a single click.
Note: If the 'popen' function is disabled in your PHP configuration, you will need to manually execute the provided command.
translations.database_description: Please provide your database connection details below.
translations.migrate_failed: ‚ùå Failed to start migration process. Please check your database connection settings.
translations.migrate_proceed_next: You can now proceed to the next step.

translations.website_mail_mailer_option_smtp: SMTP (smtp) - Sends mail using an SMTP server.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_mailgun: Mailgun (mailgun) - Sends mail using the Mailgun API.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_postmark: Postmark (postmark) - Sends mail using the Postmark API.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_resend: Resend (resend) - Sends mail using the Resend API.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_ses: Amazon SES (ses) - Sends mail using Amazon Simple Email Service.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_sendmail: Sendmail (sendmail) - Sends mail using the Sendmail command.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_log: Log (log) - Logs mail instead of sending it.
translations.website_mail_mailer_option_array: Array (array) - Stores mail in an array for testing purposes.
translations.website_mail_scheme_description: Scheme used for the mail server (http, https).

translations.website_mail_port_description: Port number of the mail server.

translations.website_mail_password_description: Password for the mail server authentication.
translations.website_aws_use_path_style_endpoint_desc: Whether to use path style endpoint for AWS services.

translations.summary_support_message: If you find this project helpful, please consider supporting us via:

translations.vendor_folder_and_autoload_present: Vendor folder and autoload file are present
translations.finalized_message:
The installation was successful. You will now be redirected to the main page.

Before proceeding, the script has executed its final tasks:

1. It attempted to remove the following code segment from the public/index.php file:
:code

Please verify that this code has been successfully deleted.

2. The setup folder has been scheduled for removal. Ensure that it has been fully deleted.

Once these checks are completed, the JSON response will trigger the redirection to the main page.
translations.install_dependencies_description: This step will install the necessary Composer packages for your Laravel application.

translations.ext_desc.ctype: The Ctype PHP Extension is required for type checking functions.
translations.ext_desc.curl: The cURL PHP Extension is required for making HTTP requests.
translations.ext_desc.dom: The DOM PHP Extension is required for working with XML and HTML documents.
translations.ext_desc.fileinfo: The Fileinfo PHP Extension is required for determining the MIME type of files.
translations.ext_desc.filter: The Filter PHP Extension is required for validating and sanitizing data.
translations.ext_desc.hash: The Hash PHP Extension is required for generating hash values.
translations.ext_desc.mbstring: The Mbstring PHP Extension is required for handling multibyte string operations.
translations.ext_desc.openssl: The OpenSSL PHP Extension is required for security features of Laravel.
translations.ext_desc.pcre: The PCRE PHP Extension is required for regular expression operations.
translations.ext_desc.pdo: The PDO PHP Extension is required for database connectivity.
translations.ext_desc.session: The Session PHP Extension is required for managing user sessions.
translations.ext_desc.tokenizer: The Tokenizer PHP Extension is required for tokenizing PHP code.
translations.ext_desc.xml: The XML PHP Extension is required for working with XML data.
translations.ext_desc.pdo_sqlite: The PDO SQLite Extension is optional for SQLite database support.
translations.ext_desc.pdo_mysql: The PDO MySQL Extension is optional for MySQL/MariaDB database support.
translations.ext_desc.pdo_pgsql: The PDO PostgreSQL Extension is optional for PostgreSQL database support.
translations.ext_desc.pdo_sqlsrv: The PDO SQL Server Extension is optional for SQL Server database support.
